fill in.translation[0].definitions[0].de: to write all the necessary information on an official document, form etc
fill in.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Don’t forget to fill in your boarding cards.
fill in.translation[0].definitions[1].de: to tell someone about recent events, especially because they have been away from a place
fill in.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: I think you’d better fill me in on what’s been happening.
fill in.translation[0].definitions[2].de: to put a substance into a hole, crack etc so it is completely full and level
fill in.translation[0].definitions[3].de: to spend time doing something unimportant because you are waiting for something to happen
fill in.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: She flipped through a magazine to fill in the time.
fill in.translation[0].definitions[4].de: to paint or draw over the space inside a shape
fill in.translation[0].definitions[5].de: to do someone’s job because they are not there
fill in.translation[0].definitions[5].ex: I’m filling in for Joe for a few days.
fill in.translation[1].definitions[0].de: someone who does someone else’s job because that person is not there
fill in.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: I’m here as a fill-in while Robert’s away.
fill in.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to write all the information that is requested on an official form
fill in.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: He filled in the usual trader’s form offering to sell the car to the finance company.
The time sheet is filled in by your supervisor.
fill in.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a person who does another person’s job for a short period of time, because the other person is not there
fill in.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: I was just a fill-in when she wasn’t available.
